abstract: Jane Raskin, one of the president’s lawyers, said that despite the purported importance of the president’s personal lawyer, House impeachment investigators did not subpoena him.
lead_paragraph: For the first time for the defense, Jane Raskin, one of the president’s lawyers, focused on the role of Rudy W. Giuliani, the president’s personal lawyer. She called him a “colorful distraction,” pointing out that despite his purported importance in the controversy, House impeachment investigators did not subpoena him to testify.
